hypothesis_content.title: Multi-Catalyst Stacking Momentum Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences concurrent negative catalysts (e.g., large liquidations + macro fears + break of key support), and the 1-hour funding rate turns significantly negative (< -0.02%), a short-squeeze rally of 3-5% will occur within the next 6-8 hours as excessive bearish positioning is unwound.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extremely negative funding rates indicate crowded short positioning. When multiple catalysts stack, they often create a sentiment extreme. A break of key support can be a 'sell the rumor, buy the news' event if the break fails to accelerate. The current setup with liquidations, macro fears, and a break of $85K fits.
entry_conditions: BTC breaks below a key weekly support level (e.g., $85K) on high volume
At least two distinct negative catalysts are cited in news (e.g., liquidations + macro)
Perpetual swap funding rate drops below -0.02% on 1H timeframe

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price declines a further 2% from entry low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The negative funding rate persists or deepens, and price continues to decline without a squeeze, indicating genuine sustained selling pressure.
